steps.name: Introduction
steps.content: Compound III employs separate liquidation collateral factors which are set higher than borrow collateral factors, to determine liquidation thresholds.

steps.name: Protection Mechanism
steps.content: These factors protect borrowers and the protocol by ensuring a safety margin for asset prices, reducing the risk of sudden liquidations due to price fluctuations.

steps.name: Governance Flexibility
steps.content: The separation of liquidation collateral factors enables governance to adjust borrow collateral factors without triggering liquidations, providing flexibility in managing risk and market conditions.

steps.name: Liquidation Eligibility
steps.content: Accounts with borrow balances surpassing the limits defined by liquidation collateral factors become eligible for liquidation.

steps.name: Risk Management and Stability
steps.content: Compound III's liquidation collateral factors play a crucial role in risk management, enhancing protocol stability by ensuring the safety of borrower positions.
